summary: The document is a declassified FBI record pertaining to the assassination of President John F. Kennedy, disclosed under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992. It details an intercepted conversation by British intelligence services between a Cuban Embassy counselor and an unidentified visitor, which may discuss Lee Harvey Oswald's attempt to secure a visa to Cuba and suggests the assassination was planned by imperialists.
key_findings: The document references a conversation intercepted by MI-5 and MI-6 involving the Cuban Embassy in London, suggesting possible motives behind the Kennedy assassination.
It mentions a visa refusal to an individual, potentially Lee Harvey Oswald, indicating his attempt to enter Cuba was denied.
The intercepted conversation implies that the assassination was perceived by some as an act orchestrated by imperialists, described as 'really disgusting'.
